about_page.title: // ABOUT PROTOMAP
about_page.intro: [SYSTEM_INITIATED] Welcome to ProtoMap ‚Äî the main gathering point for protogens in digital space. This project started as an experiment but became home to hundreds of unique signals.
about_page.desc_orion: Creator of the core, web interface, and the crazy casino economy. Ensures servers don't melt and frames keep shining.
about_page.desc_ipos: If you think ProtoMap is just a website, iposdev is preparing a surprise for you.
about_page.community_text: [COMM_LINK] The project lives thanks to you. Join our Telegram chat to talk, suggest ideas, and be the first to know about hidden updates.
about_page.disclaimer: // All map markers are anonymized. We do not store your exact coordinates.

privacy.title: //: PRIVACY POLICY
privacy.subtitle: Last updated: December 1, 2025
privacy.disclaimer_text: The ProtoMap project (this website) is an independent, non-commercial entertainment service. We are not associated, affiliated, or connected with Protomaps LLC (protomaps.com) or their products. Any resemblance in names is coincidental.
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the "Policy") describes how we collect, use, store, and protect information about users (hereinafter referred to as "Users") of the ProtoMap service.
sec1_list: By using the Service, the User expresses full consent to the terms of this Policy.
If the User disagrees with the terms of the Policy, they must immediately cease using the Service.
privacy.sec2_intro: We collect the following categories of data:
sec2_list: Account Data: Email address, hashed password, unique identifier (UID), username.
Public Profile: Information that the User voluntarily makes publicly available: avatar, status, "about me" description, links to social networks.
Game Data: Virtual currency balance ("Protocoins"), transaction history, list of purchased virtual items (inventory), game statistics.

Geolocation Data: Coordinates provided by the User for display on the map. The Service intentionally coarsens (anonymizes) this data to the level of a settlement or district before saving. Exact GPS coordinates are not stored on servers.
Content: Text comments, chat messages, and metadata associated with them (timestamps).
Technical Data: IP addresses, device type, browser data, and cookies (exclusively for authentication and security purposes).
privacy.sec3_intro: We use the collected information for:
sec3_list: Service Functioning: Authentication, displaying map markers, chat and comment functionality.
Gamification: Calculating ratings, displaying leaderboards ("Top Highrollers"), casino and shop mechanics.
Security: Detecting and blocking violators, spam protection, preventing virtual currency fraud.
sec4_list: "Protocoins", "Frames", "Badges", and other digital objects within the Service are solely elements of software code and design.
They do not have real monetary value, are not cryptocurrency, electronic money, or financial instruments.
The Service does not provide the ability to exchange virtual assets for real money (fiat) or other material goods.
privacy.sec5_intro: We do not sell or transfer Users' personal data to third parties for marketing purposes. Data may be processed by the following technical partners:
sec5_list: Google Firebase (USA): Database hosting, authentication, cloud functions.
OpenStreetMap / Nominatim: Geocoding service (used to convert coordinates into a city name without storing identity).
privacy.sec6_intro: The User has the right to:
sec6_list: Edit their personal data in profile settings.
Request full account deletion. An automated deletion function is available in the Service interface.
privacy.sec6_note: // Upon account deletion, all personal data (Email, UID, profile, marker) is permanently destroyed. Public content (messages) undergoes an anonymization procedure (unlink from identity) to preserve the continuity of public conversations.
sec7_list: The Administration reserves the right to block access to the Service for any User for violating the rules, without prior notice.
In case of blocking (ban), access to the account and virtual assets is terminated. No compensation is provided.
privacy.sec8_text: We reserve the right to make changes to this Policy. Continued use of the Service after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the new version of the Policy.

terms.title: //: TERMS OF SERVICE
terms.subtitle: Version 2.1 dated November 19, 2025
terms.disclaimer_text: The Service contains gamification elements simulating gambling games ("The Glitch Pit"). The game is played exclusively with virtual currency that has no real value. The Service is not a platform for real-money gambling.
terms.intro: This Terms of Service (hereinafter ‚Äî "Agreement") is a legally binding contract between you (hereinafter ‚Äî "User") and the ProtoMap administration (hereinafter ‚Äî "Administration", "Service").
sec1_list: Using the Service in any way (viewing, registration, posting content) implies your full and unconditional agreement to this Agreement.
If the User disagrees with the terms of the Policy, they must immediately cease using the Service.
terms.sec2_intro: To maintain a safe and friendly atmosphere, Users are prohibited from:
sec2_list: Publishing content that violates laws, copyrights, or third-party rights.
Posting spam, malicious links, or advertising third-party resources without approval.
Using profanity, insults, threats, or hate speech in comments and profiles.
Impersonating Service administrators or other individuals.
Using automated scripts (bots) to farm currency, spam, or scrape data.
terms.sec3_intro: The Service provides access to virtual currency ("Protocoins") and digital items ("Frames", "Badges"):
sec3_list: No Value: Virtual items are not the property of the User, have no monetary value, and cannot be exchanged for real money.
License: By purchasing a virtual item, you receive a limited, revocable, non-transferable license to use that interface element within the Service.
Reset and Removal: The Administration reserves the right to modify balances, remove items, or reset progress in case of technical failures, bug abuse, or rule violations.
sec4_list: Service Content: Design, logo (ProtoMap), software code, interface texts, and mechanics are the intellectual property of the Administration.

User Content: You retain copyright to the content you publish (avatars, texts). However, you grant the Service a non-exclusive license to store, display, and reproduce this content for the purpose of operating the Service.
Trademarks: Mention of any third-party brands is for informational purposes only. We are not affiliated with Protomaps LLC.
terms.sec5_intro: The Service is provided on an "AS IS" basis. The Administration does not guarantee:
sec5_list: Uninterrupted operation of the Service, absence of errors, or technical failures.
Safety of user data in case of force majeure or hacker attacks (despite all protective measures taken).
Compliance of the Service with specific goals or expectations of the User.
terms.sec6_intro: The Administration has the right to unilaterally:
sec6_list: Limit or completely block the User's access to the Service (Ban) for violating this Agreement.
Delete any information or content that violates the rules.
Refuse to restore access without explanation in case of gross violations.
sec7_list: The Administration has the right to make changes to the Agreement at any time. Changes take effect from the moment of publication.
terms.sec7_contact: Questions and claims are accepted via the official Telegram channel:

ai_policy.title: Our Stance on AI
ai_policy.subtitle: // Transparency Protocol: ERROR_LOG
ai_policy.intro_text: On December 15, 2025, our post announcing the "Glitchmas" update was removed by the moderators of the r/protogen subreddit.
ai_policy.fact_text: The post did not contain a single image generated by AI. It only featured screenshots of the website interface we developed.
ai_policy.moderation_text: When we pointed out this discrepancy, the moderator claimed programming is an "art form". But then the conversation crossed the line of professionalism:
ai_policy.moderator_quote_1: "Programming everything yourself is far more versatile and reliable than whatever slop an ai chatbot can spit out for you."
ai_policy.moderator_quote_2: "I strongly encourage that you reconsider your methods, and hone your own skills."
ai_policy.moderation_outro: Calling a complex, functioning project with a real economy and backend "slop" simply because modern tools were used is a display of personal bias, not moderation. We find this rhetoric insulting to all indie developers.
ai_policy.philosophy_title: //: OUR STANCE: AI IS A TOOL
ai_policy.point1_title: ü§ñ We Are Transparent About Using AI
ai_policy.point1_text: AI is our "copilot." It helps us write code faster, generate text, and quickly test ideas. For an indie team, it's an indispensable tool.
ai_policy.point2_text: Forbidding a developer from using an AI assistant for coding under the pretext of fighting "AI art" is like forbidding an artist from using Photoshop because it's "computer assistance." This is a false equivalence.
ai_policy.point3_text: The best argument against any suspicion is full transparency. The entire source code for ProtoMap is available on GitHub. You can check for yourself if our cloud functions and architecture are "slop".
ai_policy.conclusion_text: We will not apologize for using effective tools. We will continue to develop ProtoMap guided by common sense and respect for our users, not by the personal prejudices of moderators.

splash_modal.title: TRANSPARENCY PROTOCOL
splash_modal.intro: A brief update on a recent incident with Reddit moderation.
splash_modal.point1: Our announcement post on r/protogen was removed for "AI-assisted content".
splash_modal.point2: The moderators equated "AI assistance in code" with "AI-generated art", which is an absurd interpretation of the rules.
splash_modal.point3: We stand for transparency and modern development tools. ProtoMap is a community project, and its source code is open.
